text: the ar-15 has become a common rifle for
consumers but it's also become a weapon
of choice for mass shooters these
shooters have used them to kill dozens
at an elementary school in Connecticut a
movie theater in Colorado a concert in
Las Vegas and now at a church in Texas
among others some of the factors that
make the ar-15 popular with consumers
may also help explain why mass murderers
have opted to use them too they're
capable of firing rounds that can go
straight through a human body and
penetrate a wall behind it they're
lightweight and easy to use
since the muzzle doesn't rise up much it
doesn't take a lot of effort to bring it
back down acquire a proper sight line
and to fire again a weapon that's
already deadly can potentially be made
more dangerous by adding things like
four grips scopes and red dot sights the
guns are expensive but they're within
reach they cost between five hundred and
nine hundred dollars the ar-15 model is
basically a consumer version of
military-grade assault rifles such as
the m16 or the m4 carbine they look
almost identical the big difference the
ar-15 is semi-automatic the m16 and m4
can be switched to automatic or burst
ar-15s were prohibited under the assault
weapons ban from 1994 to 2004 but since
that ended sales have surged ar-15s have
been branded under the term modern
sporting rifle which gives a weapon
design for war a consumer-friendly label
the gun is also marketed for home
defense but although they're clearly
strong enough to stop an intruder
critics say the ar-15 could also cause
unintended damage or even death in
untrained hands one thing is clear no
matter who's using it it can be an
extremely lethal weapon
you
